misc.name: git playground
misc.desc:
A simple git playground for you to test simple git commands.

Note that everything in the sandbox are either from public releases, distro tarballs, or built from unmodified upstream source with common toolchains under normal architectures. Nothing strange and weird here.

ssh -p 50087 root@git-playground.chal.hitconctf.com

Author: asef18766

rev.name: huge hashtable
rev.desc:
Have you ever thought about having a gigantic array to avoid the hash table?
Using the huge virtual memory space with a complicated hash function should be pretty large enough to omit the needs of collision handling when implementing a hash table, especially the preimage attack should be infeasible, right?

ncat huge-hashtable.chal.hitconctf.com 50087
